results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Revcom Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge. Bondi. Sydney Bush. Cars
results.brief_description: A compilation of four experimental films made by filmmaker, Paul Winkler, between 1977 - 1980: “Sydney Harbour Bridge”, “Bondi”, “Sydney Bush” and “Cars”.

results.title: Wild about wilderness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: Deborah Conway hosts this video which attempts to define wilderness areas that are left. All wilderness areas shown are from New South Wales. Finishes with the sobering thought that what we don’t save now is lost for ever.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.

results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth O'Neill, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth O’Neill, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.

results.title: Sunshine and shadow
results.creator_credit: Lisa Ades, Ric Burns, New York Historical Society, Steeplechase Films, Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: Building for learning
results.brief_description: As the Victorian population increases, the problem of providing school buildings and accomodation becomes more and more accentuated. The purpose of this film is to show the progress being made in this regard, and the problems associated with the building shortage. It also demonstrates the work being done in the various departments of the school and provides a valuable opportunity of showing to children, teachers, parents and other interested adults just what is being done in Victoria to meet the demands of a growing population for the best and the latest in the educational field. Commentary by Max Meldrum, drawings by Betty Jope.

Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
